private_information: type: truck
speed: 4
trucks can drive between places and are not at any place while driving
cannot pick up crates by themselves; require hoists for load/unload
truck0.goal: Assist with transporting crates between places as needed to achieve global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

private_information: type: truck
speed: 5
trucks can drive between places and are not at any place while driving
cannot pick up crates by themselves; require hoists for load/unload
truck1.goal: Assist with transporting crates between places as needed to achieve global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

private_information: type: hoist
power: 3
hoists stay at their place and can lift/putdown/load/unload crates
lifting/putdown durations: lift 1 time unit, putdown 1 time unit, load/unload weight/power
hoist must be available to start lift/unload actions
hoist0.goal: Manipulate crates at its location to enable achieving global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

private_information: type: hoist
power: 7
hoists stay at their place and can lift/putdown/load/unload crates
lifting/putdown durations: lift 1 time unit, putdown 1 time unit, load/unload weight/power
hoist must be available to start lift/unload actions
hoist1.goal: Manipulate crates at its location to enable achieving global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

private_information: type: hoist
power: 9
hoists stay at their place and can lift/putdown/load/unload crates
lifting/putdown durations: lift 1 time unit, putdown 1 time unit, load/unload weight/power
hoist must be available to start lift/unload actions
hoist2.goal: Manipulate crates at its location to enable achieving global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the specified crate-on relations while minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks move between places with duration = distance(from,to)/speed(truck) and are not at any place while driving.
Hoists stay at a place and perform lift/putdown/load/unload actions; load/unload duration = weight(crate)/power(hoist); lift/putdown last 1 time unit.
Surfaces can be pallets or crates; crates are movable and can serve as surfaces.
The world contains a depot and distributors as specified in init.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems involving trucks and hoists. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You must produce a PDDL domain and problem (temporal) representing trucks, hoists, crates, pallets, places, numeric fluents for distances, speeds, weights and powers, and include actions with start/over all/end conditions and start/end effects capturing the described semantics. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions are clearly assigned to agents and respect agent constraints.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The truck0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
The truck1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoist0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
The hoist1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
The hoist2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a temporal PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the numeric fluents. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
